weather_report:
As the first hints of dawn creep over Downtown San Francisco, the night air remains lightly laden with moisture and a whisper of fog. The city awakens under a mostly cloudy sky, with temperatures settling comfortably in the mid-50s. The gentle southwest wind carries a refreshing chill, cradling the essence of the ocean just beyond the horizon, teasing the promise of what’s to come when the sunlight breaks through the somber clouds.

By midday, the forecast hints at a transformation: a sunlit embrace as warmth envelops the city, nudging temperatures up into the low 60s. The clouds will make their retreat, leaving behind a canvas of brilliant blue. As the winds pick up strength, gusts reaching upwards of 21 mph will sweep through the streets, creating a lively atmosphere perfect for a leisurely stroll along the waterfront. It might be wise to dress in layers—a light jacket to fend off the morning coolness, giving way to something more breathable as the sun claims its throne. Engage in the city’s mosaic of life; perhaps one might wander into a quaint café for a quiet moment, people-watching over a steaming cup of coffee, or meander to a park, where the rustle of leaves speaks to the rhythm of the day. The fog may linger as a subtle reminder of the coast, but the clarity above will offer a perfect stage for enjoying the myriad charms this vibrant city has to offer.
